column1: We have now entered the most critical phase of this terrible war. There is a lull in the storm
column2: but the hurricane is not over. Doubtless we must expect more fierce outbreaks
column3: and ere it is finally exhausted there will be many more. The fate of the empire
column5: and the fate of liberty throughout the world may depend on the success with which the very last of these attacks is resisted and countered. The Government
column7: propose to submit to Parliament today certain recommendations
column8: in order to assist this country and the Allies to weather the storm. They will involve
column10: extreme sacrifices on the part of large classes of the population
column11: and nothing would justify them but the most extreme necessity and the fact that we are fighting for all that is essential and most sacred in our national life.
